CatDescriptText: Mr. Donald Williams, Fifth Ward and Mr. Lee Page, seminary student, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 29, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that laws should be made and enforced to eliminate segregation and discrimination, or should education and "moral persuasion" be used instead?"  Mr. Williams' answer reads: "A combination of both would be the best."  Mr. Page's answer reads: "I don't think that it will come about by laws.  It's something that you have to have within you.  And I think that the best place to start is in the church regardless of whether it be Catholic, Protestant or Jewish."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donald Williams wearing dark cap and plaid shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Lee Page wearing eyeglasses and patterned short sleeve shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
